content:
I can tell you that there is growing public support for criminal justice reform in the federal district and around the country. recent polls have shown that a majority of americans support various criminal justice reform measures, such as reducing mandatory minimums, increasing funding for rehabilitation programs, and improving police training.

additionally, there has been widespread public outcry following numerous high-profile incidents of police brutality, racial profiling, and other examples of systemic bias and discrimination in the criminal justice system. this has led to a groundswell of support for reforms aimed at addressing these issues.

while there are still some who oppose criminal justice reform, overall, there is a growing recognition that the current system is not delivering justice fairly and equitably to all individuals. as such, meaningful reform has become a priority for many lawmakers, advocacy groups, and concerned citizens.
